newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Cold Storage swaps asset with Dairy Farm.
newsitem.headline: Cold Storage swaps asset with Dairy Farm.

text.p: Malaysia's Cold Storage (M) Bhd said on Wednesday it has entered agreements with Dairy Farm International Holdings Ltd to swap stakes in their retail pharmacy businesses.
The asset swap meant that the two companies under the Jardine Strategic Holdings Ltd stable will work closely together in the future, Cold Storage said in a statement.
Jardine Strategic is a substantial shareholder in Cold Storage and is the holding company of Dairy Farm.
Under the deal, Cold Storage will sell its 30 percent stake in wholly-owned Cold Storage Retail Sdn Bhd to Dairy Farm for 30.40 million ringgit in cash.
In exchange, it will buy a 30 percent stake in Dairy Farm's Guardian SEA Pte Ltd for S$13.80 million in cash.
Cold Storage Retail operates one of the largest retail pharmacy chains in Malaysia under the Guardian name which has 47 Guardian outlets.
Guardian SEA has 54 Guardian retail operations in Singapore and owns the franchise for Guardian operations in Indonesia and Brunei. It also runs a Singapore pharmacy wholesaling business.
Cold Storage will also buy a 70 percent stake in a new wholesaling business being established in Malaysia under Dairy Farm's AMS Health Care Products Sdn Bhd for S$3.29 million.
